content:
• Friday, February 3, 2012
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) falls 4.7% AH after announcing it's slashing coal production at...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) falls 4.7% AH after announcing it's slashing coal production at some of its Kentucky and West Virginia mines, on account of lower demand. The cutbacks will reduce annual production by roughly 4M tons, and results in the displacement of about 320 employees. Alpha adds rising natural gas production is affecting its coal sales to utilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $244M (+6.2% Y/Y)...

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $244M (+6.2% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • CVCO

    Cavco (CVCO +11.9%), a maker of factory-built homes, hit a new 52-week high after reporting FQ3...

    Cavco (CVCO +11.9%), a maker of factory-built homes, hit a new 52-week high after reporting FQ3 revenue of $114.6M (+189% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.24. Results were boosted by Cavco's acquisition of rival Palm Harbor Homes, partly offset by seasonality.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image (SIMG +14.9%) finished with a big gain after delivering a Q4 beat, and guiding for...

    Silicon Image (SIMG +14.9%) finished with a big gain after delivering a Q4 beat, and guiding for Q1 revenue of $51M-$55M ($51.9M consensus). Q4 sales were fueled by growing shipments of the company's MHL interface chips for transmitting HD video from mobile devices. During its earnings call, Silicon Image predicted the number of smartphones shipping with its MHL chips will double in 2012 to over 100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • ASRT

    Depomed (DEPO +4.9%) finished strong today after announcing earlier that Merck (NYSE:MRK) had...

    Depomed (DEPO +4.9%) finished strong today after announcing earlier that Merck (NYSE:MRK) had received FDA approval for Janumet XR, a new treatment for type 2 diabetes. Depomed has provided Merck with licenses to certain patents related to the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • CNXN

    IT hardware distributor PC Connection (PCCC -19%) crashed after reporting Q4 revenue of $553M...

    IT hardware distributor PC Connection (PCCC -19%) crashed after reporting Q4 revenue of $553M (down slightly Y/Y) and EPS of $0.28; the latter was well below a Street forecast of $0.36. An 8.6% decline in sales to SMBs offset a 17.3% increase in sales to larger enterprises. In addition, PC Connection announced a CFO change.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ZGNX

    Drug developer Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) falls 8.4% AH after filing for a $75M mixed shelf offering....

    Drug developer Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) falls 8.4% AH after filing for a $75M mixed shelf offering. Zogenix says it will use the proceeds to fund the commercialization of its Sumavel DosePro migraine drug and (pending FDA approval) and its controversial Zohydro painkiller.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • KRA

    Kraton Performance Polymers (KRA -3.4%) is cut to Sell from Neutral by Goldman Sachs after the...

    Kraton Performance Polymers (KRA -3.4%) is cut to Sell from Neutral by Goldman Sachs after the stock's recent rally following improving sentiment and signs that destocking is abating. Goldman says the share price has "risen too far, too fast without the fundamental improvements to justify the outperformance."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • TTEK

    Tetra Tech (TTEK +6.1%) catches an updraft after being raised to Outperform at Baird. The firm...

    Tetra Tech (TTEK +6.1%) catches an updraft after being raised to Outperform at Baird. The firm cites the company's solid execution, an evolving platform, and improving sentiment for E&Cs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • FB

    The love-fest from Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) IPO extends into its second day, as Zynga (ZNGA +7.5%)...

    The love-fest from Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) IPO extends into its second day, as Zynga (ZNGA +7.5%) shares add to yesterday's 17% jump. But the options market isn’t so sure the rally is sustainable, as ZNGA’s “fear gauge” - a reading of 30-day implied volatility - jumps to a new high of 120%. At the least, traders view the stock as one with lots of volatility in its future.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +2.7%) trades up after Goldman upgraded the shares earlier today to Buy,...

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +2.7%) trades up after Goldman upgraded the shares earlier today to Buy, citing expectations for an end market recovery and better propane/propylene spreads.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • DRYS

    Shares of DryShips (DRYS +10.1%) pull a rally out of thin air - surging over the last 30 minutes...

    Shares of DryShips (DRYS +10.1%) pull a rally out of thin air - surging over the last 30 minutes of trading. Erick McKitterick set off an options volatility warning on the stock earlier in the day noting a 33-to-1 call-to-put ratio.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion (ALXN +1.3%) moves up after Goldman ups the shares to Conviction Buy, citing its high...

    Alexion (ALXN +1.3%) moves up after Goldman ups the shares to Conviction Buy, citing its high growth potential, unique drug franchise and being ripe for a takeover.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • NOV

    Adding to National Oilwell's (NOV +6.3%) strength on its earlier announcement that it plans to...

    Adding to National Oilwell's (NOV +6.3%) strength on its earlier announcement that it plans to buy a pipe firm, Morgan Stanley says it's upping the stock to Overweight, citing a growing backlog that should drive the shares higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • MNKD

    MannKind's (MNKD -13%) offering of 31.25M units priced at a 2.8% discount to yesterday's closing...

    MannKind's (MNKD -13%) offering of 31.25M units priced at a 2.8% discount to yesterday's closing price sends shares plunging well below their $2.40 offering price and approaching a 52-week low. Earlier this week, the drug developer disclosed plans for the arrangement, which sees some of its debt cancelled in exchange for the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +6.4%) and MetroPCS (PCS +3%) have enjoyed much of the cheap smartphone...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +6.4%) and MetroPCS (PCS +3%) have enjoyed much of the cheap smartphone pre-paid market, but BTIG believes that could change with the plan America Movil (AMX +3.8%) is expected to offer in the U.S., a SIM card that can be used in any AT&T (NYSE:T) or T-Mobile phone, including the "the healthy inventory of used iPhones." (NASDAQ:AAPL)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +2.8%) says it will close a locomotive assembly plant in Canada where unionized...

    Caterpillar (CAT +2.8%) says it will close a locomotive assembly plant in Canada where unionized workers have been locked out since the beginning of the year after they refused to accept pay cuts and other concessions. The Canadian Auto Workers Union says CAT never intended to keep the plant open.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 21 Comments
  • AET

    Aetna (AET -1.8%) ticks lower after Goldman cut the shares to Buy from Conviction Buy on...

    Aetna (AET -1.8%) ticks lower after Goldman cut the shares to Buy from Conviction Buy on valuation this morning, saying the stock has limited upside remaining.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • PKI

    Impressed by PerkinElmer's (PKI +7%) "shock and awe" Q4 results, Jefferies raises its earnings...

    Impressed by PerkinElmer's (PKI +7%) "shock and awe" Q4 results, Jefferies raises its earnings estimates and price target to $27 from $23. "Our focus remains on PKI's ability to consistently drive OP margin expansion," the firm says. The provider of equipment for genetic screening and drug research forecasts 2012 EPS of $1.98-$2.04 vs. $1.91 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • KMX

    CarMax (KMX -2.4%) dips after being cut to Sector Perform at RBC earlier today. The firm says...

    CarMax (KMX -2.4%) dips after being cut to Sector Perform at RBC earlier today. The firm says its lack of late model vehicles and higher average car prices have put the company at a competitive disadvantage and reduced earnings visibility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • SMT

    Interactive whiteboard maker Smart Technologies (SMT -13.2%) plummets post-earnings, as soft...

    Interactive whiteboard maker Smart Technologies (SMT -13.2%) plummets post-earnings, as soft guidance overshadows its FQ3 beat. Smart expects its FY12 sales growth to be at the low end of a prior guidance range of flat to -5%, and expects its net income to fall 10% Y/Y, worse than prior guidance for no change. A 500 bps Y/Y drop in Smart's FQ3 gross margin, to 43%, could also be weighing on shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG +3.3%) has spent the last four years selling off more than $50B in assets, but that may...

    AIG (AIG +3.3%) has spent the last four years selling off more than $50B in assets, but that may be about to change. Chairman Steve Miller tells Bloomberg TV that the insurer is ready to go on the offensive, now focused on growth and returning capital to investors: “We have high confidence... and we’re willing to put our money where our mouth is and talk about repurchasing of shares.”
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • EL

    Estee Lauder (EL -3.6%) heads lower after delivering mixed FQ2 results and guiding for FY12 EPS...

    Estee Lauder (EL -3.6%) heads lower after delivering mixed FQ2 results and guiding for FY12 EPS of $2.16-$2.23, below a $2.26 consensus. A significant ramp in ad spending leads Estee to guide for FQ3 EPS of just $0.28-$0.32, well below a $0.41 consensus. However, the company notes strong demand from wealthy U.S. consumers is propping up sales, and offsetting weak Euro demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways Group (LCC +5.9%) says consolidated January traffic rose 3.7% as capacity increased...

    US Airways Group (LCC +5.9%) says consolidated January traffic rose 3.7% as capacity increased for a second straight month. Passenger revenue per available seat mile, a key profitability metric, also increased nearly 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • UTI

    Universal Technical Institute (UTI -4.1%) trades down after its FQ1 earnings missed estimates...

    Universal Technical Institute (UTI -4.1%) trades down after its FQ1 earnings missed estimates earlier today. Revenue fell 61% Y/Y as the for-profit educator reported continued declines in student enrollment due to tougher admissions regulations.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • MU

    Shares of Micron (NASDAQ:MU) are halted pending news after recording a steady 3% gain on the...

    Shares of Micron (NASDAQ:MU) are halted pending news after recording a steady 3% gain on the day. SA author Cameron Kaine already identified Micron as a beat-up stock that could rebound off of a turn up in consumer confidence.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • NVLS-OLD

    Novellus (NVLS-OLD -0.7%), which closed yesterday near its 52-week high, is underperforming in...

    Novellus (NVLS-OLD -0.7%), which closed yesterday near its 52-week high, is underperforming in spite of beating Q4 estimates, and guiding on its earnings call for Q1 revenue of $300M-$330M and EPS of $0.71-$0.86 (consensus of $306.2M and $0.66). A valuation-based downgrade from D.A. Davidson is likely playing a role. However, Needham (Buy) expects both Street estimates and shares to move higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • THO

    Thor Industries (THO +6%) pops after saying preliminary second-quarter revenue rose 13% Y/Y to...

    Thor Industries (THO +6%) pops after saying preliminary second-quarter revenue rose 13% Y/Y to $596M, well above analysts' expectations for $551M as RV and bus sales continued to strengthen.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • PPO

    Polypore (PPO +6%) continues to rebound (previously) after getting crushed this week on news of...

    Polypore (PPO +6%) continues to rebound (previously) after getting crushed this week on news of customer LG Chem building a battery separator plant that would reduce its need for Polypore's separators. A conference call discussing Polypore's separator business seems to be helping, even though LG Chem wasn't directly mentioned. (CC slides - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +4.1%) more than doubles the maximum consideration payable in its debt...

    Bank of America (BAC +4.1%) more than doubles the maximum consideration payable in its debt tender offer to $3.5B from $1.5B, after saying the offer was oversubscribed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • COLM

    Columbia Sportswear (COLM +4%) moves up after reporting a largely in-line Q4, and despite a...

    Columbia Sportswear (COLM +4%) moves up after reporting a largely in-line Q4, and despite a gloomy FY12 outlook. Profit rose 40% Y/Y on improved margins and better revenue across virtually all regions, with particular strength in Latin America and Asia.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (STRI -20.1%) freefalls after preannouncing Q4 revenue of $36.5M (-63% Y/Y) and EPS...

    STR Holdings (STRI -20.1%) freefalls after preannouncing Q4 revenue of $36.5M (-63% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.04, far below a consensus of $44M and $0.10. The maker of solar encapsulents says that while there was an uptick in German solar installations in late 2011, the demand was mostly satisfied through existing module inventory. STR had previously warned on its Q2 and Q3 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion Technology (SIMO +9.51%) pops after its Q4 results blew out analysts'...

    Silicon Motion Technology (SIMO +9.51%) pops after its Q4 results blew out analysts' expectations. FY11 revenue was up 69% Y/Y due to continued strength in the company's mobile storage OEM business and unexpected growth from its module-maker business.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • AMSC

    Shares of wind turbine parts maker American Superconductor (AMSC +9.7%) are lifted by peer...

    Shares of wind turbine parts maker American Superconductor (AMSC +9.7%) are lifted by peer Zoltek's (ZOLT +38%) strong quarter and the Obama administration's fast-track plans for making areas off the coasts of Maryland and New Jersey available to wind-energy developers by year's end. Also: OPTT +15.8%, BWEN +10.5%, CPST +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • CTCT

    Down AH yesterday following its Q1 report (I, II), Constant Contact (CTCT +23.4%) takes off...

    Down AH yesterday following its Q1 report (I, II), Constant Contact (CTCT +23.4%) takes off today. Investors might be starting to view the company, which recently announced the general availability of its Social Campaigns marketing product, as a Facebook play. Oppenheimer (Outperform) thinks Social Campaigns could both boost Constant Contact's ARPU, and re-accelerate its customer growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • PRO

    Shares of Pros Holdings (PRO +5.1%) shoot up on volume 3X normal trading activity after...

    Shares of Pros Holdings (PRO +5.1%) shoot up on volume 3X normal trading activity after Craig-Hallum launches coverage with a Buy rating. The B2B software provider continue to draw buying interest - up 21% over the last month - despite sporting lofty valuation multiples.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • DRC

    Dresser-Rand (DRC -7.3%) shares slump after the maker of equipment for oil and natural gas firms...

    Dresser-Rand (DRC -7.3%) shares slump after the maker of equipment for oil and natural gas firms reduces its forecast for 2012 operating income to a range of $360M-$420M from $390M-$450M. Delays in new unit bookings, which DRC says will come in ~$200M lower during Q4 than its earlier forecast, are expected to shift related revenues from 2012 to 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +3.2%) says it plans to fast-track a large portion of its recently...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +3.2%) says it plans to fast-track a large portion of its recently unveiled share buyback program, planning to repurchase $850M in shares by the third quarter of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • MRVL

    Network processor vendor Cavium (CAVM -1.7%) isn't joining in on today's rally, after delivering...

    Network processor vendor Cavium (CAVM -1.7%) isn't joining in on today's rally, after delivering mixed Q4 results (estimates lowered following December warning) and issuing below-consensus Q1 guidance. However, Needham (Buy) is lifting its PT to $36, asserting growth will resume in Q2, thanks to demand for both new and existing products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML +2.5%) shares bounce back from last night's selloff after the touch controller...

    Atmel (ATML +2.5%) shares bounce back from last night's selloff after the touch controller chipmaker warned its Q4 revenue would miss even reduced forecasts. UBS reiterates its Buy rating, expecting a bottom in Q1 and a recovery in Q2. FBR's electronics supply chain sources say ATML is “still winning the lion’s share of designs for touch controllers in 2012." CY +4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • PEET

    Peet's Coffee (PEET +7.3%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Baird,...

    Peet's Coffee (PEET +7.3%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Baird, citing potential earnings growth acceleration in the second half of 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • IDIX

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX -8.6%) turn tail after compelling new data from rival...

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX -8.6%) turn tail after compelling new data from rival Gilead (GILD +8.5%) puts prospects for IDIX's hepatitis C drug in question. Brean Murray reiterates its Sell rating and $3 price target, believing the profile of GILD's experimental drug is too strong for the IDIX drug to remain viable. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM

  • Up 1.4% today and crossing the 2,900 mark, the Nasdaq hits an 11-year high (Bush and Gore were...

    Up 1.4% today and crossing the 2,900 mark, the Nasdaq hits an 11-year high (Bush and Gore were duking the election out in the courts then). The index is 11.3% higher YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • VRTX

    Vertex (VRTX -7.3%) shares sink a day after rising 4% on better-than-expected earnings driven by...

    Vertex (VRTX -7.3%) shares sink a day after rising 4% on better-than-expected earnings driven by sales of its Incivek hepatitis C drug. But today, Goldman Sachs and Cowen both downgrade the stock to Neutral from Buy based on VRTX's 2012 guidance in its conference call, while still viewing the company as high quality with innovative R&D.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • ZOLT

    Zoltek (ZOLT +38.6%) shares skyrocket after beating on earnings and revenues in its FQ1 report....

    Zoltek (ZOLT +38.6%) shares skyrocket after beating on earnings and revenues in its FQ1 report. The producer of carbon fibers used to produce windmills says the large turbine segment of wind energy will increase at 15%-25% annually for the next decade or more. Forbes' Eric Savitz also suspects shares are getting a boost from short covering.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBT

    BB&T (BBT +3.3%) will acquire the insurance businesses of privately-held Crump Group for...

    BB&T (BBT +3.3%) will acquire the insurance businesses of privately-held Crump Group for $570M. Crump's life insurance unit is one of the largest wholesale distributors of services to support the sale of life-related insurance and annuity products. The operations are expected to add ~$300M in annual revenue to BB&T's insurance unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • WBC

    WABCO Holdings (WBC +6.5%) trades up after releasing mixed Q4 results but raising guidance for...

    WABCO Holdings (WBC +6.5%) trades up after releasing mixed Q4 results but raising guidance for FQ1. Piper Jaffray upgrades the shares on the report, saying the new guidance range is based on a market-wide contraction of 10%-15% in Europe, and for management to release in-line guidance under those conditions speaks volumes about its confidence in other regions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • ATHX

    Shares of Athersys (ATHX +3.2%) bounce higher after the firm presents positive data on its...

    Shares of Athersys (ATHX +3.2%) bounce higher after the firm presents positive data on its MultiStem heart stroke treatment. The firm believes the stroke market represents a commercial opportunity of more than $15B annually.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +9.1%) wows investors with new data from its lead hepatitis C drug,...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +9.1%) wows investors with new data from its lead hepatitis C drug, overshadowing disappointing Q4 earnings and weak guidance. GILD's conference call suggested that a two-drug combination of pills may be potent enough to cure patients with genotype 1 hepatitis C, the most common form of the disease in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • ACAT

    Feltl and Company lifts its rating on Arctic Cat (NASDAQ:ACAT) to Strong Buy from Buy. Shares...

    Feltl and Company lifts its rating on Arctic Cat (NASDAQ:ACAT) to Strong Buy from Buy. Shares are up 5.7% on the day, adding to a 39% YTD return.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • WY

    Weyerhaeuser (WY +4.2%) trades up in relief after its Q4 beats consensus estimates despite a 62%...

    Weyerhaeuser (WY +4.2%) trades up in relief after its Q4 beats consensus estimates despite a 62% Y/Y drop in earnings on slowing sales and write-downs. Wood products - the company's biggest segment by sales - saw revenue decline 14% Q/Q, while its loss from continuing operations also widened sequentially, but the hit was not as great as anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW -9.2%) is the S&P 500's worst performer after missing on Q4...

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW -9.2%) is the S&P 500's worst performer after missing on Q4 revenues and issuing a weak Q1 outlook. Wells Fargo cuts shares to Market Perform from Outperform, mostly due to near-term uncertainty around EW's Sapien catheter-delivered heart valve, especially non-U.S. sales. Wells' price target range is cut to $81-83 from $91-93.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • APKT

    In spite of missing Q4 estimates and offering weak 2012 guidance, Acme Packet (APKT +5.3%) has...

    In spite of missing Q4 estimates and offering weak 2012 guidance, Acme Packet (APKT +5.3%) has turned positive, as investors decide the provider of voice-over-IP infrastructure gear, whose shares are down 62% from their April high, has suffered enough. Nonetheless, Needham is downgrading shares to Hold, stating it's worried about the lack of visibility into Acme's promised 2H growth. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • INFN

    Infinera (INFN +19%) skyrockets after its Q4 report (I, II) revealed it to be relatively immune...

    Infinera (INFN +19%) skyrockets after its Q4 report (I, II) revealed it to be relatively immune from the capex issues hitting other telecom equipment names (I, II, III). Even mildly soft guidance (Q1 revenue of $102M-$108M and EPS of -$.10 to -$.14 vs. consensus of $102.5M and -$0.10) isn't getting in the way.  Helping is an upgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan, which is encouraged by the pending arrival of Infinera's 100-gig equipment. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • PKI

    Shares of PerkinElmer (PKI +4.4%) gain steam off of a Q4 earnings beat and the firm's improved...

    Shares of PerkinElmer (PKI +4.4%) gain steam off of a Q4 earnings beat and the firm's improved outlook for 2012. The company now sees EPS of $1.98-$2.04, higher than the consensus estimate mark of analysts of $1.92.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • QRTEA

    Liberty Media (LINTA +2.9%) is upgraded to Overweight from Equal Weight with a raised target...

    Liberty Media (LINTA +2.9%) is upgraded to Overweight from Equal Weight with a raised target price of $21 from $19 at Morgan Stanley, which considers LINTA's QVC business “a unique retail asset... undervalued at a 10% free cash flow yield due to complexity,” but where management is taking steps to clarify the structure of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +6.1%) takes off after naming new management and catching an upgrade to...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +6.1%) takes off after naming new management and catching an upgrade to Buy from Janney on its big potential in H2. Jefferies goes in a different direction - keeping a negative tone on the stock as it reiterates an Underperform rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • GLW

    Corning (GLW +2.4%), which badly needs new growth opportunities for its display glass business,...

    Corning (GLW +2.4%), which badly needs new growth opportunities for its display glass business, is forming a JV with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) that will produce substrates based on Corning's Lotus Glass for Samsung's OLED mobile displays. The news is a positive for OLED technology and materials supplier Universal Display (PANL +2.8%), which counts Samsung as its largest customer.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • TSN

    Shares of Tyson Foods (TSN +3.9%) trade higher after the firm beats consensus estimates with its...

    Shares of Tyson Foods (TSN +3.9%) trade higher after the firm beats consensus estimates with its top-line and bottom-line FQ1 results. The firm's chicken segment turned back to profitability to help offset sagging profit in its beef segment on lower volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • C

    Bank stocks enjoy a big lift from the better-than-expected jobs report. Bank of America +3.2%...

    Bank stocks enjoy a big lift from the better-than-expected jobs report. Bank of America +3.2% premarket; after starting the year below $6/share, shares are poised to cross $7.50. Also: C +2.7%, MS +2%, JPM +1.9%, GS +1.6%, WFC +1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • ARR

    Shares of Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR) tilt 2.9% lower in premarket trading on word that the...

    Shares of Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR) tilt 2.9% lower in premarket trading on word that the firm has priced 26M shares in an underwritten public offering that closes on Feb. 8.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • RHI

    The stronger-than-expected NFP report bodes well for the sector of companies tied to staffing...

    The stronger-than-expected NFP report bodes well for the sector of companies tied to staffing and job searches. On the move: RHI +1.4%, LNKD +1.3%, MWW +0.9%. On the watchlist: KELYA, KFRC, RHI.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • CLX

    Clorox (NYSE:CLX): FQ2 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $1.22B (+4% Y/Y) beats by $20M....

    Clorox (NYSE:CLX): FQ2 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $1.22B (+4% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares +1.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM

    Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) +7.6% premarket after reporting late Thursday Q4 EPS of $0.22,...

    Walgreen (WAG) says that Jan. sales came in at $5.8B - marking a 2.3% Y/Y decrease due to slower prescription and flu shot business. The negative impact of losing prescriptions from Express Scripts was 10.6 percentage points.
